sentences.english: All patients were enforced recumbency and treated with large amount of fluid.
sentences.chinese: 治疗措施包括卧床休息，大量补充液体。

sentences.english: She was bed-ridden after small successive strokes;
sentences.chinese: 在接连的小中风后她卧床不起。

sentences.english: Position child with head of bed slightly elevated to decrease cerebral edema; monitor administration of fluids.
sentences.chinese: 卧床时，床头略微抬高，减少脑水肿，监视补液情况。

sentences.english: My father was then bed-ridden at Chinsurah.
sentences.chinese: 那时父亲已在钦苏拉卧床不起了。

sentences.english: He was bedridden for three weeks, but ultimately healed.
sentences.chinese: 随后，杰克逊三周卧床不起，但最终得以康复。

sentences.english: Eric is on his back now; I haven't seen him for quite a few days.
sentences.chinese: 艾瑞克卧床不起了，我好几天没有见到他了。

sentences.english: Take this medicine and stay in bed.
Too ill to get out of bed, she had strong feelings of uselessness.
sentences.chinese: 由于疾病缠身，卧床不起，她深深感到力不从心。

sentences.english: They have been ill in bed for about two years.
sentences.chinese: 他们生病卧床不起已经两年了。

sentences.english: Don't stay in bed longer than a day or two unless your docter advises it.
sentences.chinese: 卧床最好不要超过一到两天，医嘱除外。

sentences.english: After the traffic accident he lay in bed for a week, wating for his wound to heal.
sentences.chinese: 交通事故发生后他卧床一周，等待伤口痊愈。

sentences.english: He overworked too much that he fell ill in bed.
sentences.chinese: 他太过分劳累以至生病而卧床。

sentences.english: The application of the vertebral body can reduce the postoperative bed-rest.
sentences.chinese: 人工椎体的应用能进一步缩短患者卧床时间。

sentences.english: Study on health eduction route to prevent coprostasis for bedridden patients in orthopaedics.
sentences.chinese: 健康教育路径对预防骨科卧床病人便秘的临床研究。

sentences.english: The nonunion rate is increased, as are complications associated with prolonged recumbency .
sentences.chinese: 然而，骨不连率增加，这与长期卧床有关。

sentences.english: I had my meals brought to me when I was ill in bed with a bad cold.
sentences.chinese: 我得了重感冒卧床不起的时候，让别人把饭送来。

definition: to be in hospital/to be hospitalized
to receive hospital treatment/to be hospitalized
old illness recurs (idiom); a relapse/fig. to repeat an old error/the same old problem
paralysis of one side of the body/hemiplegia
to look after a hospitalized loved one
to recuperate/to convalesce/to take care of one's health after illness
to leave hospital/to be discharged from hospital
